intro: Chamaesyce filicaulis, commonly known as the fernleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Cariandraceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. It produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Chamaesyce filicaulis thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
